content:
Thank you for providing this information. Based on your requirements, here are some traits and skills to look for while assembling your 2nd-grade teaching team:

1. Strong subject knowledge: Ensure that each teacher has a strong background in either reading comprehension or mathematics. The reading interventionalist may be a strong asset for the reading comprehension aspect, while the transfer teacher or the veteran might be proficient in mathematics.
2. Collaborative mindset: Look for teachers who are open to working together, sharing ideas, and learning from one another. A successful teaching team will be one where all members communicate effectively and are open to feedback.
3. Leadership potential: Since the veteran teacher is looking for leadership responsibilities, assess their ability to lead the team and foster a supportive and motivating environment. Strong leadership will be crucial for creating a high-performing team.
4. Adaptability: Teachers should be willing and able to adapt their teaching methods and materials to cater to different learning needs and styles. This is especially important in a 2nd-grade setting where students may have varying levels of skill and understanding.
5. Passion for teaching and student success: Look for teachers who are passionate about their work and genuinely care about the success of their students. This passion will help drive the team to achieve your goal of making this the highest-performing team in the school.
6. Creativity and problem-solving: Teachers who can think outside the box and develop innovative strategies for teaching will help keep students engaged and make learning more enjoyable.
7. Classroom management: Effective classroom management is crucial for maintaining a productive learning environment. Teachers should be able to establish clear expectations, routines, and consequences for their students.
8. Continuous professional development: Look for teachers who are committed to continually improving their teaching skills and staying updated on best practices.

For the new teacher you're looking to hire, consider these traits and skills as well. It might be beneficial to hire someone with a strong background in mathematics to balance the team's expertise or someone with experience in differentiated instruction to cater to diverse learning needs.

Finally, once you have assembled your team, invest time in team-building activities and provide opportunities for professional development to help your teachers grow and work effectively together.
